text: Mohammad Najeeb Qasmi Sambhali is an Indian Sunni Islamic scholar. He is founder of Al-Noor Public School, Sambhal and has authored nearly 50 books. ==Family background== Qasmi is a grandson of Ismail Sambhali who was a muhaddith and an activist of the Indian Independence movement. Sambhali was Shaykh al-Hadith at Jamia Qasmia Madrasa Shahi, Moradabad in India and his students include Athar Mubarakpuri and Nizamuddin Asir Adrawi. ==Education== Qasmi studied traditional dars-e-nizami from Darul Uloom Deoband, and graduated from there in 1994. He gained a Bachelor of Arts degree from Jamia Millia Islamia and a Master of Arts degree in Arabic from Delhi University. He earned a Doctor of Philosophy degree in hadith studies from Jamia Millia Islamia. ==Career== Qasmi established Al-Noor Public School in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh on 21 December 2018. The foundation stone was laid down by teachers of the Darul Uloom Deoband and Jamia Millia Islamia. Qasmi’s articles have appeared in Monthly al-Bayyinat of Jamia Binoria. Qasmi's articles also appear in The Inquilab, The Munsif Daily, The Siasat Daily, Urdu Times, Avadhnama and other Indian and Pakistani newspapers like Daily Jang and Daily Express. Numerous articles of Qasmi have appeared on Jahan-e-Urdu. Qasmi also writes on his website, which was released in a function held in Riyadh on 4 January 2013 by a number of Indian scholars. Saudi Gazette in its report called the website a brain child of Qasmi. At the launch program, Qasmi said, "Given the popularity of the Internet, many new websites with Islamic names are launched regularly, misinterpreting Islamic teachings. This website provides reliable Islamic content for users". ===Hajj-e-Mabroor=== Qasmi launched Hajj-e-Mabroor application to help provide accurate information about Hajj and Umrah. It was released in 2015 in by Muhammad Mustafa Azmi The application has articles, books and videos of Qasmi in English, Hindi and Urdu covering various aspects of Hajj and Umrah. ==Literary works== Qasmi's set of 38 books was released by Muhammad Mustafa Azmi. whilst his 6 books were released in Ansari auditorium of Jamia Millia Islamia by the former VC of JMI Talat Ahmad, Akhtarul Wasey and Abul Qasim Nomani. Qasmi's books include: * Qur’an & Hadith - Main Sources of Islamic Ideology *Umrah Ka Tariqah * Islahi Mazameen (released by Akhtarul Wasey) * Dars-e-Quran *Dars-e-Hadith * Journey to Madina ==Awards== * Watan Ke Ratna Award 2019 ==Reflections== Padma Shri Akhtarul Wasey said about Qasmi that: "I often read his electronic articles. His moderate and scholarly articles always touch me. I express my gratitude to Maulana Najeeb Qasmi and pray for his long life to Allah". ==See also== * Muhammad Mustafa Al-A'zami * Darul Uloom Deoband * Jamia Millia Islamia == References == == External links == *Mohammad Najeeb Qasmi Sambhali - Official Website *Dr. Mohammad Najeeb Qasmi's posts - The Clear Evidence Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:People from Sambhal district Category:Indian male writers Category:Scholars from Uttar Pradesh Category:Islamic studies scholars Category:Muslim scholars Category:Indian Sunni Muslim scholars of Islam Category:Indian scholars of Islam Category:Deobandis Category:Darul Uloom Deoband alumni Category:University of Delhi alumni Category:Jamia Millia Islamia alumni
